nodes.long_description: SketchUp is one of the most popular 3D modeling tool for architects, designers, engineers, and hobbyists. Now you can unlock the power of SketchUp in VR. Visualize the models you have created in SketchUp desktop, mobile, and web with your favorite Quest device. Stay connected with project stakeholders using Trimble's cloud collaboration tool, Trimble Connect. Immerse yourself and your customers in compelling immersive walkthroughs of your design, and make design decisions faster and most effectively than ever before. Cycle through the various design options, or simply hide and show objects leveraging the native Scenes, Tags, and Outliner features. Experience your 3D SketchUp models in immersive mode or enjoy our new Home Environment to explore your 3D model in tabletop mode.
nodes.short_description: SketchUp Viewer for Meta Quest makes it easier than ever to view your SketchUp models in virtual reality and amaze your customers and stakeholders. Available now for Meta Quest 2, Meta Quest 3, and Meta Quest Pro, you can experience your designs in an immersive environment without the need for a complex setup or a powerful desktop machine. Leverage features including Scenes, Outliner, Tape Measure, and our brand new Home Environment to showcase your designs and make better design decisions.

nodes.short_description: SketchUp Viewer for Quest makes it easier than ever to view your SketchUp models in virtual reality and amaze your customers and stakeholders. Available now for Quest 2 and Quest Pro, you can now experience your designs in an immersive environment without the need for a complex setup or a powerful desktop machine. nodes.change_log:
Version 3.4.0.0 Bug Fixes
* The right version is now visible in the "About" page
* The Scanned Spaces tray now lists the scanned space files in descending order (from newest to oldest)
* The "Labs" button now leads to the correct Scan Space Labs page on SketchUp's Help Center.

SketchUp Viewer Beta for Quest - What's New: 
With this release, we are introducing “Scan Space”, the latest SketchUp Labs feature. “Scan Space” offers you a novel way to capture your real space by using your Quest device, turning it into a SketchUp model, and publishing it to Trimble Connect. This new capability will allow you to quickly scan a room, and instantly turn it into a usable SketchUp model that you can edit in any of your favorite SketchUp authoring tools (Desktop, Web, or iPad). Once you have completed your design, come back to SketchUp Viewer on your Quest device to visualize your new design in its real-world context by utilizing the new “Return to Alignment” button that locks your model into the real world! 

* Scan Space: Turn real-world spaces into tagged SketchUp models using Quest’s native “Space Setup” capabilities. 
* Return to Alignment: Perfectly align the models you have scanned back into your real space using the "Return to Alignment" feature. 
* Eye-Height Adjustment: You can now set your Eye-height to be dynamically adjusted to your real-world eye height or manually adjust it through the Settings menu. Release Notes: 

Scan Space: 
1. Introduced the Scan Space feature accessible from the Home menu after a user signs in. 
2. Added one more Tray in the Home menu where you can find all previous scans. 
3. Scan Space launches Quest’s native scan application that allows you to scan a new room or use an existing scan. Automatic scanning is available for Quest 3 devices. 
4. Scanned room is converted to a SKP model 
5. Recognized entities are automatically assigned SketchUp Tags (only available in Quest 3). 
6. Automatically assigned SketchUp Tags include Bed, Ceiling, Couch, Door, Lamp, Miscellaneous, Plant, Screen, Storage, Table, Wall, Wall Art, Window. 
7. SketchUp models that are generated from room scans are automatically published to the user’s Trimble Connect account. 
8. The generated SketchUp Model is saved to the “Scanned Spaces” project that is automatically created under the default Trimble Connect location of the user. 
9. All SketchUp models that are generated from room scans also receive the “scanned_spaces” tag once they are published in Trimble Connect. 
10. Once a scan is completed, the user is positioned at the center of the scanned room in immersive mode, and Passthrough is enabled. 
11. All faces generated by the room scan automatically receive semi-transparent SketchUp Materials so that the model blends with the real world. 
12. Objects that are generated via the scan space feature are created as individual components, and each object of the same category is assigned the appropriate Tag. 

Scan Space - Return to Alignment: 
1. New “Return to Alignment” button added on the horizontal toolbar 
2. Return to Alignment seeks and identifies spatial anchors that are stored in previously scanned models. 
3. If the current model is generated via the scan space feature and has spatial anchors stored, the Return to Alignment function automatically snaps the model to its original position in the real world. 
4. When Return to Alignment is available and activated, Passthrough is automatically enabled. 

Eye-Height Adjustment: 
1. A new option for Eye-Height is introduced under the Settings menu. 
2. Dynamic Eye-Height option matches the viewer's eye-height to their real-world eye-height by aligning the virtual and real-world floor 
3. Manual adjustment allows the possibility to offset the eye-height at a specified length. 

Bug fixes: 
1. Fixed a Trimble Connect upload/download failure after a model scan is complete. 
2. The upload(s) will start (if it has failed earlier for any number of sessions) whenever the user returns to the home screen and once the internet connection is available and stable.

SketchUp Viewer Beta for Quest - What's New:
With this release, we are introducing “Scan Space”, the latest SketchUp Labs feature. 
“Scan Space” offers you a novel way to capture your real space by using your Quest device, turning it into a SketchUp model, and publishing it to Trimble Connect. This new capability will allow you to quickly scan a room, and instantly turn it into a usable SketchUp model that you can edit in any of your favorite SketchUp authoring tools (Desktop, Web, or iPad). Once you have completed your design, come back to SketchUp Viewer on your Quest device to visualize your new design in its real-world context by utilizing the new “Return to Alignment” button that locks your model into the real world!
Scan Space: Turn real-world spaces into tagged SketchUp models using Quest’s native “Space Setup” capabilities.
Return to Alignment: Perfectly align the models you have scanned back into your real space using the "Return to Alignment" feature.
Eye-Height Adjustment: You can now set your Eye-height to be dynamically adjusted to your real-world eye height or manually adjust it through the Settings menu.

Release Notes:
Scan Space:
1. Introduced the Scan Space feature accessible from the Home menu after a user signs in.
2. Added one more Tray in the Home menu where you can find all previous scans.
3. Scan Space launches Quest’s native scan application that allows you to scan a new room or use an existing scan. Automatic scanning is available for Quest 3 devices.
4. Scanned room is converted to a SKP model
5. Recognized entities are automatically assigned SketchUp Tags (only available in Quest 3). 
6. Automatically assigned SketchUp Tags include Bed, Ceiling, Couch, Door, Lamp, Miscellaneous, Plant, Screen, Storage, Table, Wall, Wall Art, Window.
7. SketchUp models that are generated from room scans are automatically published to the user’s Trimble Connect account.
8. The generated SketchUp Model is saved to the “Scanned Spaces” project that is automatically created under the default Trimble Connect location of the user.
9. All SketchUp models that are generated from room scans also receive the “scanned_spaces” tag once they are published in Trimble Connect.
10. Once a scan is completed, the user is positioned at the center of the scanned room in immersive mode, and Passthrough is enabled.
11. All faces generated by the room scan automatically receive semi-transparent SketchUp Materials so that the model blends with the real world.
12. Objects that are generated via the scan space feature are created as individual components, and each object of the same category is assigned the appropriate Tag.

Scan Space - Return to Alignment:
1. New “Return to Alignment” button added on the horizontal toolbar
2. Return to Alignment seeks and identifies spatial anchors that are stored in previously scanned models. 
3. If the current model is generated via the scan space feature and has spatial anchors stored, the Return to Alignment function automatically snaps the model to its original position in the real world.
4. When Return to Alignment is available and activated, Passthrough is automatically enabled.

Eye-Height Adjustment:
1. A new option for Eye-Height is introduced under the Settings menu.
2. Dynamic Eye-Height option matches the viewer's eye-height to their real-world eye-height by aligning the virtual and real-world floor
3. Manual adjustment allows the possibility to offset the eye-height at a specified length. 

Bug fixes:
1. Fixed a Trimble Connect upload/download failure after a model scan is complete.
2. The upload(s) will start (if it has failed earlier for any number of sessions) whenever the user returns to the home screen and once the internet connection is available and stable.

Version 3.3.0 of the SketchUp Viewer for Quest brings a major update to the user interface, with a completely redesigned Trays menu. The new Trays menu is more legible, comfortable, and easy to use, with a look and feel consistent with the rest of the SketchUp family across Desktop, Web, and Mobile. We are additionally introducing a new Settings menu where all general, model, and navigation configurations will be hosted.

Release Notes:
New "Trays" UI with larger fonts, "scrollable" panels, and animated effects.
New "Entity Info" pop-up label (accessible via the Outliner menu) provides information such as Name, Instance, Area, Volume, and Tag when an object is selected.
New Settings button added to the horizontal toolbar.
New Settings menu organized into three categories: General, Navigation, and Model.
General category includes options for table visibility and height in tabletop mode, and Grid visibility in immersive mode.
Navigation category includes a Walk Speed option with three settings: Slow, Moderate, and Fast (available in presentation mode only).
Model category includes a dropdown menu for selecting Units.
